block.para: Here are two basic properties which are specific to linear transformations and are not enjoyed by every transformation.

li.para: A linear transformation f\from \RNr[n]\to \RNr[m] sends the 0-vector of \RNr[n] to the 0-vector of \RNr[m]; in symbols: f(\Vect{0}) = \Vect{0}.
A linear transformation f\from \RNr[n]\to \RNr[m] transforms any linear motion in \RNr[n] into a linear motion in \RNr[m].

block.para: The first property is frequently helpful in detecting non-linear maps. The second property explains the name "linear transformations".
